TITLE_CONTRACT.P: Technical consultancy framework primarily for children's services.

SHORT_CONTRACT_DESCRIPTION.P: The Council intends to appoint a number of Construction Professional consultancy firms to offer the provision of construction-related consultancy services primarily for children's services projects. These services include the building services and its associated supply chain including mechanical and electrical services and architectural services and associated supply chain for educational projects on behalf of the Council from inception to completion and set up. The types of projects anticipated in this contract include, but are not limited to:
Planned maintenance either capital and revenue projects;
Mechanical and electrical installation works and services;

Although primarily for children's services/education property, this framework for Hackney will therefore intend to support a wide range of construction projects across all areas and types of construction work and across all directorates within the Council. This framework will also be offered for use by Hackney Schools.

There are three lots on the framework, building surveying, architects and independent cost consultants. Note that all firms need to specialise in education projects, with experience of operating whilst the school is in term time. In some cases services may be commissioned directly from the supply chain within and across the lots.

F02_ANNEX_B.LOT_TITLE: Building surveying and associated supply chain services

LOT_DESCRIPTION.P: Building surveying services for schools, inclusive of related design supply chain (mechanical, electrical, structural engineers, quantity surveyors, landscape architects etc) and associated services, for example fire risk assessments, DDA, asbestos surveys.

The majority of work in this lot will comprise the Asset Management Programme for school buildings. We will also invite schools to make use of this framework. Work packages may be bundled for example roofing works, mechanical and electrical works. However we anticipated that 10 % of instructions will be under 250 000 GBP.
The likely number of consultants on the framework under this lot would be 3.

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: Current asset management programme level is 4 300 000 GBP for 2011/12.

F02_ANNEX_B.LOT_TITLE: Architects and associated supply chain - specialist

LOT_DESCRIPTION.P: Architectural and associated supply chain services, inclusive of related design supply chain (mechanical, electrical, structural engineers, quantity surveyors, client design advisers, landscape architects etc) and associated services for example fire risk assessments, DDA, asbestos surveys. Specialist design advice of educational conservation, listed buildings etc.
The likely number of consultants on the framework under this lot would be 3.

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: Difficult to estimate at this time in the current financial climate but there may be a number of school extension projects over the period of the framework to take into account the need for school places.

LOT_DESCRIPTION.P: Quantity Surveying and cost control services inclusive of ability to lead and advise on EU procurements or tenders using whole life costing. To monitor and co-ordinate performance, assist with strategic contracts and provide a full QS service on some projects where appropriate.
It is envisaged that 1 firm will be appointed to the framework on this lot.

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: Difficult to estimate at this point. Services may be required to augment one of the other two lots, or to act independently of them. Additionally the services may be used to quality/value check work on the current capital building programme.

In the current climate expenditure on education capital projects is uncertain; however there is an annual asset management programme of repair and refurbishment works which was valued at 4 300 000 GBP for 2010/11. Additionally other projects may be funded based on school place requirements or in response to housing redevelopments.

EXECUTION_SERVICE_RESERVED_PARTICULAR_PR.P: Bidders will need to be members of the relevant professional body for the service for which they are applying.

OPE_OBJECTIVE_CRITERIA.P: Set out in the PQQ and memorandum of information.

PLACE_NOT_STRUCTURED.P: Hackney Procurement Services, Keltan House, London E8 4RU, UNITED KINGDOM.

ADDITIONAL_INFORMATION.P: Note that there are three lots. Lot 1 will be tendered before Lots 2 and 3 with an estimated tender issue and return date as stated in this document.
Lots 2 and 3 will be tendered (estimated) in June 2011.
Whilst the services will be mainly used directly by the Council, the framework will be opened up to schools in the Borough for their use directly should they wish.

LODGING_OF_APPEALS_PRECISION.P: This authority will incorporate a minimum 10 calendar day standstill period at the point information on the award of the contract is communicated to tenderers. This period allows unsuccessful tenderers to seek further debriefing from the contracting authority before the contract is entered into. Applicants have two working days from notification of the award decision to request additional debriefing and that information has to be provided a minimum of 3 working days before expiry of the standstill period. Such additional information should be requested from the address in section 1.1 If an appeal regarding the award of a contract has not been successfully resolved the Public Contracts Regulations 2006 provide for aggrieved parties who have been harmed or are at risk of harm by a breach of the rules to take action in the High Court (England, Wales and Northern Ireland). Any such action must be brought promptly (generally within 3 months). Where a contract has not been entered into the court may order the settling aside of the award decision or order the authority to amend any document and may award damages. If the contract has been entered into the court may only award damages.
